Within 5 days of exposure, patients develop a classic triad of descending flaccid paralysis with prominent bulbar palsies, normal mental status, and normal body temperature. Bulbar signs include the “4 Ds”: dysarthria, dysphonia, dysphagia, and diplopia. Diagnostic confirmation relies on identifying the botulinum toxin. Antitoxin therapy and supportive care should be provided.
